result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory Bernard Cotton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca AMENDED FROM Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

Defendant Gregory Bernard Cotton in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Gregory Bernard Cotton in custody.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jane Slaght.
Parties have reviewed the PSI and note no additions or corrections for the record. 

15CF1058: Ct.1-3: 1 yr RCJ- Concurrent to each other. 

15CF1413: Ct.1- 6 yrs WPS 3 yr IC/3 yr ES- Consecutive to 15CF1058

15CM1767: Ct.1- 1 yr RCJ Concurrent to 15CF1058 & 16CF754. Consecutive to 15CF1413

16CF754: Cts. 2 & 3- 1 yr RCJ- Concurrent to each other & 15CF1058, Consecutive to 15CF1413

CONDITIONS: 
Absolute sobriety
Random UAs/Breathalyzers
No association with drug dealers/users
AODA counseling
Full time employment
GED/HSED
No contact with all victims. S.M, D.D. L.G.
Mental health assessment
Take all meds as prescribed.

FAW
VOTE
DNA Sample
CC+COS+DNA surcharges
CFTS.

Preliminary hearing on July 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Gregory Bernard Cotton in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Defendant Gregory Bernard Cotton in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.
